title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: The questions are relevant and the overall interview process is very easy to navigate. Highly recommend working for bjc! Usually there is a phone interview and then an in person interview, following that.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: I had an interaction with a recruiter who appeared disinterested, solely requesting a resume walkthrough without further dialogue or questioning. Later, in response to my thank-you email, the recruiter made an erroneous statement claiming that I lacked experience in a particular area, when in fact, that area is one of my strongest strengths. My attempt to clarify the situation was ignored. Since then, all applications I have submitted have been rejected, indicating that the recruiter's inaccurate assessment has significantly impacted my career prospects with BJC.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Just initial interview with HR recruiter. Just wanted to post how laughable their comp was! 65k for this position…. Companies like these need to recognize the FMV of their employees and future employees

title: Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Kirkwood, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was long. I was immediately scheduled to speak with a recruiter who shortly followed up with another follow up interview with the manager. I didn’t hear back for about 2 months and eventually got into a second interview. Although it took months for me to get an offer, I’m so happy that I waited to hear back. My onboarding coordinator was very caring, checked with me throughout the process and occupational health staff were so friendly! I was sick prior to my appointments for occupational health and a quick 1:1 to touch base about the role and everyone was extremely accommodating to me. Everyone worked well to make sure all the boxes for onboarding was checked!

title: Specialist Interview

title: Medical Technologist Interview

title: Intake Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was pretty disorganized. I would get emails regarding upcoming interview from multiple HR people and it was difficulty to know who my point of contact was. The HR person also didn't seem to know much AT ALL about the job I was applying for. She couldn't even give me a firm answer on what location I'd be working at and originally told me the wrong one.

Once speaking with the hiring manager, she was friendly and upbeat about the experience of working a BJC. She also was careful to put on her "politician face" to evade directly answering questions related to how fast paced the environment was and what the workload would be like. She said she'd call me the following week to tell me if I had the job.

Then I get another email from IT who says that the hiring manager AND her supervisor wanted to interview me together now. So what was the point of the first one?

The hiring manager's demeanor changed with her supervisor there and she let him do most of the talking. The supervisor wanted to know about my experience with triaging client, performing intake assessment, approaching sensitive topics with clients, etc. 

Overall, the two of them were fairly pleasant. But it was clear that even they didn't have a clear answer to what location I'd work at...
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with triaging clients to decide who has the most urgent needs and needs to be seen first?

title: Lab Associate I Interview

Step 3: Virtual Interview with Hiring Manager & Supervisor.
Step 4: On-site Job Shadowing with the team.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
This was the worst interview experience I have ever had. I was up for two different positions at Barnes and got offered a final round interview for both. The recruiter that I was working with asked my minimum salary requirement, which I told her. She responded by saying that position A won’t be able to meet that requirement, and that position B would be a better fit for that reason. 

With that knowledge from the recruiter, I dropped out of interviews for position A and went to the last round interview with position B. They told me during the interview that they would like to verbally offer me the job, and to look out for a formal offer. The formal offer took 9 weeks to arrive. I went multiple weeks at a time without hearing an update from anyone about where in the process the offer was. 

The worst part, though, was that when I got the offer, the recruiter called me to tell me that the salary they were offering was significantly lower ( by 10k+) than the minimum salary I told them (a minimum that she said was within range for that position when she encouraged me to move forward with this interview over the other position I was interviewing for).  She was very condescending and kept saying things like “I know you gave us your minimum salary requirement but what’s your REAL minimum?” Another disappointing thing was that the salary they offered was less than the salary range listed for position A (which is the one she told me could never meet my minimum). 

I probably would’ve considered accepting this offer (even with the salary below my minimum) if I had gotten it under better circumstances. But I just felt manipulated by the time this whole ordeal was over, and I was angry about several other opportunities with other companies that I had turned down after I had gotten my verbal offer from BJC, since the process had taken 9 weeks. BJC should really work on making sure their recruiters are relating accurate information to their interviewees. It was disappointing to waste so much time and give up another opportunity at BJC, and others outside BJC, based on false information from HR.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions with a presentation portion

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was given clear instructions on how to get into the hospital complex, where to park, and where to pick up my visitors pass. SLCH has a very strict visiting policy, you will not be allowed to navigate the hospital without first checking in. They ask, who are you? Where are you going? and who are you here to see? I had a panel interview and it went pretty well. The team from this department was pretty down to earth, and seemed genuinely interested in getting someone who would be a good fit of the position. I was asked backs PALS questions- getting the questions wrong were not punitive, more so show the educator where I was and how she could help me during orientation. After the interview, they were timely with regards to giving me answers where they were in the hiring process, and if I was still being considered for the position. This is very nice since some places don't even bother to tell you you are no longer in the running.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply at SLCH?

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: This experience consisted of shadowing for 3 hours and an interview afterward. I shadowed on a general medicine floor and followed a nurse. I'm glad I did this because I realized within 30 minutes I did not want to work there. My nurse was responsible for 5-6 patients (some were 100% dependent for ADLs) with no techs on the floor. The supply room was missing essential items the nurses needed and multiple nurses stated this was the norm. Also, some were discussing the need to see an eye doctor and the soonest appointment being 4 months away with employee health (benefits are an important consideration for a position). After shadowing, the interview is conducted panel style. They read questions off of a sheet, none of which seemed personal. The interviewers did not say anything about themselves (schools, experience, etc) until after the interview questions had been answered. Usually this is done as an introduction to make the interviewee feel comfortable. I did clinicals at this hospital and did not have this negative experience, so maybe it was department specific. To be transparent, I did not get the job offer but after that experience I would not have taken the position anyway.
Interview Questions: All 6  questions were from a formalized sheet which required an answer in a specific 3 part format. The answer format was similar to problem, solution, outcome. They were all supposed to be answered with what you have done during your nursing experience.

Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2018

Interview Questions: How would you respond? They asked me several hypothetical situations. Focusing on prioritization and critical thinking. They also wanted to know how my nursing background would help their demographic. I let them know my thoughts and how I would implement them.

They ask you question like why would you like to work for bjc or they will ask if  the hours work good for you just like a regular interview.Then if that person likes you and you pass they will give you a time and date to go meet the hiring manger. Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called me and we set up a phone interview. 40 minute phone interview went very well, I was very prepared and thorough and lady was nice. She ended with stating that she would email me information regarding my unit interview later in the day. (She even gave me directions and went through salary in detail) I patiently awaited an email that never came. I called after 2 days to leave a voicemail respectfully asking to please advise if position was still available as I had not received said email. Never heard back...until 2 weeks later the same recruiter called AND emailed wanting to know if I wanted to interview for the same position (the one I had already interviewed with her for!) While it really annoyed me that she had clearly forgotten that we had already spoken, I responded with both phone call and email and again, never heard back. Uh, what?! have no respect for a company who doesn't have the decency to respond and actually goes out of the way to deliberately ignore candidates. How unprofessional and disappointing.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview by HR recruiter, then in person interview with hiring manager, then called to meet with the team of case managers.  The team of case managers appear to work harder and not smarter!. Consistently made discouraging statements about the position during the interview, so I asked myself, why would I want to work with an unhappy group of individuals?  Answer:  I don't, no offer was made and accepted a different position elsewhere!
Interview Questions: I was asked various questions about how my skills will transfer to case management.  I am a case manager and aware of the role!  Why do you want to be a case manager?. Asked the same question several times by different case managers.  Felt like the Twilight Zone!

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: the online application process was pretty straightforward however, it took a long time to get into the site which may indicate the sheer volume of people applying. It did take a while after I applied before someone from HR contacted me.  me. I enjoyed that all the interviews were one-on-one and there were no panel interviews.
Interview Questions: how do you have a balance of life/work

title: Patient Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions:
Very easy, Laid-back Interviewers but this definitely could be based on the position. First they will call you and set up a phone interview. The phone interview lasts about 15minutes, they ask around 5 questions as well as the simple ones such as Do you smoke? What is your compensation goal. 
Once this is completed, I received an in-person interview with the office manager where I accepted the position.
Interview Questions:
Tell me a time you made a mistake?
When have you experienced diversity in your life or past job positions.
When did you go above and beyond your job title?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I have three interviews; supervisors, peers, manager. The entire process from start to finish took a week. I went through a recruiter who was very helpful through the process and gave me a lot of insight on the job.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength/weakness?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: They were very thorough, and very nice.  The job expectations were made very clear.  I interviewed with Human Resources,and then had a group interview in the department.  They offered to let me come back another day to shadow for a couple of hours to see what the job would be like.  I decided that the job was not what I was looking for, and did not pursue it further.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time you failed at something on the job.

title: Technical Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Washington, DC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was flawless and it was like any other IT interview. It is comprised of technical and theoretical questions. You have to be more specific while explaining the questions. I have been contacted three days ago and it was kind of promising. I have been scheduled for another face to face interview as well
Interview Questions: past history

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: You shadow a nurse, then you interview with the unit manager, and lastly, you interview with someone at the HR. Pretty backwards but that is how they do it.
Interview Questions: Something like: Tell me a time when you were in a "x" situation and how was it resolve.

title: Medical Exchange Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter was used, who screened references with 30 question surveys, then I was interviewed over the phone for 20 minutes. A few days later I interviewed with the manager, and 2 days after that I was interviewed by team members
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were able to improve procedures at a job without being asked to do so?

title: Quality Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online after a conversation with the hiring manager. Within a week, HR contacted me asking for references. In-person interview at BJC campus a couple days later with a hiring panel of 3 people, immediately followed by a 1-on-1 conversation with HR. An official offer was extended just under a week later.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation where it was difficult to get team buy-in.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application online. A few days later I was asked to fill out references and take a test. The test was basically like situational. I was asked to come in to shadow a tech for a hour and a half and then a face to face interview with the hiring manager and with other techs (peer interview).
Interview Questions: Name a time when you gave excellent care

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 ladies who interviewed me.  They were very nice and down to earth.  They made me feel very comfortable.  It was more of a conversation than feeling like I was put on the spot.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 2-3 years.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
This was an In person interview, followed by a test on Epic, EPIC 2 hour test,multiple phone calls with HR folks that called repeatedly. 
This was an In person interview, followed by a test on Epic, EPIC 2 hour test,multiple phone calls with HR folks that called repeatedly.
Interview Questions: Had to do presentations for interview group.

title: Social Work Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: This is an interview for practicum students. The interview is easy. My two supervisors interviewed me and they asked some normal and easy questions. The important thing is that you need to make the interview as a conversation and let your employer know your passion and strengths.
Interview Questions: what do you want to learn from the internship, what is your previous experiences, do you like documentation because we need to do a lot of documentations, what are your weakness and strengths

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Questions were not too hard.  Interview was professional, but laid-back.  I met one-on-one with the lady from HR and she was very nice. I then had a second round of interviewing with the supervisor of the position.  After the interview, I didn't hear anything, but followed up with HR every week for any progress.  After 1 month, they told me I had not been chosen, but she recommended me for another position.  After another week I got a second interview for a different position and was offered the job within the next week.
Interview Questions: What is your best quality?

title: RCM Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Lenghthy process. Job descriptions are generic and do not match the position being interviewed for. Pay is not listed like other organization (WASHU). It would be nice to know if you are applying for a position within you range however, this information is not available. This potientially wastes the candidate's and HR's times. Not clear about the lenght of the process.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 or 1:2 face to face interview with a couple of supervisors managing each department. Briefly go over the job duties and ask questions about exposure and experiences in the field. weigh highly on trauma and OR experiences.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable running C-arms?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was done by a very professional but yet down to earth individual. The process began with an online application, then skill testing, then online reference check, HR interview then hiring manager interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this company?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions:
Initially they were very prompt and forth-coming about how the interview process would work. First round was a phone interview with a Recruiter, followed by a phone interview by the Hiring Manager. Both were fairly easy interviews. Then there was a writing exercise followed by an in-person interview with the Hiring Manager which was basically a repeat of the phone interview. I was told that fit would be the most important part of this interview process.

Shortly afterwards a panel interview was scheduled with 5 people from the team. The interview process was 5 behavioral questions (one question asked by each team member) and was quite short. I was prepared for the behavioral questions and used the STAR technique to answer each other. I was unable to answer the final question that was asked which I think was a mistake since they were rating each of my answers and comparing to the other candidates.

When I followed up 2 weeks later, I was told that a decision would be made in a couple of weeks. Another month went by and I got an email asking for my references. They requested 5 references including 2 managers for an on-line reference system (SkillSurvey) and when my references didn't answer quickly enough, the Recruiter followed-up with me. I didn't hear anything for several more weeks when I received a phone call from the Recruiter letting me know that the Hiring Manager had moved on with other candidates.

Overall, this was a very time-consuming interview process that was unnecessarily long. The whole process was very impersonal and formal.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you have used collaboration skills.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was short and to the point. The mangers were very nice and respectful, they made me feel like part of the team already. I met with two mangers and got the Job the next day.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for us?

title: Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to come in for an interview very shortly after expressing interest. I didn't have the typical application process as I was a transfer. The interview was more productive and in depth than any other I've had. The department supervisors who interviewed me asked relevant questions and also took their time answering all of mine. For something that is most often somewhat stressful, I actually enjoyed this one. I was introduced to the staff and given a tour afterwards.
Interview Questions: Why I would fit in to the culture.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Interview with recruiter
A bit of a long process with less an ideal communication stream
Followed with interview with hiring manager that was very conversational. 
Interview covered a lot, felt like a blur. Left feeling unsure of my performance. 2 weeks later I was contacted by the recruiter, they asked again why I was looking for a new position and my current salary. I answered then they said they would call back after meeting with the manager. The recruiter called back 20 minutes later and offered me the job.
Interview Questions: How do report and solve problems?

title: Performance Improvement Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions:
Step 1: Phone interview with Recruiter - Formal interview questions "tell me about a time when..."

Step 2: Face to Face interview with hiring manager and one team member - Very relaxed conversation, "walk me through your resume".

Step 3: Face to Face interview with Peer team and 2 interviews with Vice Presidents - Peer team had typical interview questions: "how do you prioritize work", "how do you influence others", etc... VP interview was just a relaxed conversation.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult problem you've ever worked on? How did you

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I came in for two interviews and was told that I would hear from them in 3 weeks. They called back in less than 48 hours.  They must have really wanted me to fill the position.
Interview Questions: They asked how I led groups or took initiative on previous projects.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process at Children's is different depending on which department you are applying. I applied for 2 ICU's and both of them went differently. 

In one, I met with the management team including Nurse Manager, Lead Charge Nurse (they call it something different though), and Nurse Educator. 

In the other, I met with the Nurse Manager and an HR person.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you made a mistake. What did you do after the mistake was made?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: First a phone interview and then an in-person interview with the hiring manager, the director over the manager, the medical director and then three staff members.  The phone interview was a 10 minute call arranged ahead of time.  Standard HR interview questions from someone who knew really nothing about the position.  The in-person interview wasn't much better.  A director that was full of himself.  A manager that didn't know how to interview.  A physician who already knew who he wanted.  Three staff members just happy to get away from their chores for a while.
Interview Questions: Why I would be perfect for the job.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online after speaking to nurse manager of department.  Talent aquistion called and scheduled phone screening completed.  I had interview with manager and charge nurses.  When I came  for interview,  which I confirmed day prior, all had forgotten.  They discussed the problems of the unit of which I felt I could assist with change.  Offered position when I got home by recruiter.  It was not the full time position I was told.  They said I would make more but since I said yes, they never inquired to increase it.  Started orientation 3 days later.  Very rushed orientation and I feel it was just to get a warm, experienced body to work.
Interview Questions: What are your plans for furthering your education

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR to conduct a preliminary phone interview. I was shortly called within a couple days to come in for a day long interview process. It consisted of shadowing a social worker, interviewing with a panel of current social work employees, and finally interviewing with the social work supervisor and manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Barnes-Jewish Hospital?

title: EVS Manager - PM Shift Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with group of other Managers, but was discounted as not qualified immediately due to lack of experience with Barnes-Jewish, despite 20 plus years experience in the field.  I did not feel appreciated for the work I had done thus far at Barnes-Jewish.  The interview was only a courtesy and they had no intention of giving me a shot at the position.
Interview Questions: My understanding of the culture of the organization on the South campus.

title: Registered Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Peters, MO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I first received an email asking me to set up a phone interview with the recruiter. After my phone interview I met with the area manager who supervises the medical offices on the BJSPH campus. Once I interviewed with her she then set up an interview for me to meet with the physician and his office manager. By the time I got home I had received a call offering me the position. Total time was about 2-2.5 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Implementation Coordinator (EPIC) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied internally through myBJC job portal. The job description matched my skill set, so I sent in my application. I heard back about 2 weeks later asking to schedule an interview. I then received several emails cancelling and rescheduling my interview only to have it end up being back at the original time. When I arrived at the interview, I was asked about my experience. I explained my various jobs and accomplishments as they related to the job description I had read. That turned out to be my biggest mistake. The job description could not have been more inaccurate for the position. I was asked about experience that never showed up on the job description, but was apparently required. Since I did not have this experience, I was essentially told that I was not the right person for the job. The candor of the interviewers was nice in that it did not leave me wondering, but the process on the whole was extremely frustrating. I had essentially prepped for the wrong interview, as the job description posted by HR had nothing to do with what the hiring manager was looking for.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was ill prepared and unaware that interview was a one on one. Questions were more geared to me providing possible solutions to existing project decisions to be made rather than behavioral or technical questions.
Interview Questions: Given the scope of the program, how would you manage the overall budget as well as the individual project budgets?

title: RMA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: First round was an email to schedule for a phone interview. I want into the office for a second interview with the assistant manager. Thirdly I met the Lead Manager and was hired a couple of days later via call.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had a difficult pt/client?

title: Medical Technologist I Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication was consistent and reliable; First interview- talent acquisition specialist; Second interview- lab managers; offer made within two weeks; the talent acquisition specialist was extremely personable and made great efforts to keep me informed throughout the entire process.
Interview Questions: What is/are your weakness(es)?

title: Mlt Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: They are precise and to the point. I thought i would be there for a long time but that was not the case . It is not easy to get into the BJC network, but once in the opportunities for growth are numerous.
Interview Questions: Why Barnes Jewish Hospital of all places?

title: Plant Operations Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Columbia, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews with HR  the first as a sceening to determine my qualifications abd the second to determine if I would be willing to accept an offer if it was presented to me,  A third Interview was with a group of 6 co staff and manaqgers,
Interview Questions: The specifics of wiring a 3-phase motor

title: Patient Accounts Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I did a phone interview first. I was asked if I was tobacco/nicotine free (including e-cigarettes) since they are a smoke free company. This was verified during the drug screening. My phone interview took about 15-20 minutes then we scheduled the in person interview at the end of the call. I met with the department manager a few days later. Her interview was very laid back and easy going. It was more like just having a conversation compared to being in an uncomfortable interview. I was offered the position the following morning.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Human Resource Coordinator Interview

This is usually a few days after the phone screen. The interview may last about an hour or so. Business casual or professional is expected. Interview consists of questions about past experience, why BJC, and company culture.
Interview Questions: What do you know about BJC HealthCare?

title: A Salaried Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview - confirming eligibility to work in US.  Questions around customers, difficult situations and projects worked on.  Scenarios with management, situations where influence was needed.  favorite tasks and least favorite parts of the job.

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Initially the recruiter was very timely and informative. She even went as far as to reschedule my interview when I could not make the first one. After I did go to the interview I heard nothing back.They were aware that I was already employed just looking for a new line of work, the interview ended up being a hour which only consisted of company history and previous job experience. It caused me to be late to my current job, but they never even called me to tell me whether I had it or not. I had even reached out but received no response.
Interview Questions: I would say it was just the typical interview questions, it was obvious they were looking for something in particular but Im unsure what it was.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Very slow on follow up. It takes HR forever to make a decision. The process leaves a lot to be desired on the communication front. Poor negotiating skills. Salaries do not follow the going market rate.

title: TA Specialist Interview

title: Patient Care Technician Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Staff RN Interview

title: Patient Access Interview

Interview Descriptions: Phone and group and peer interview. It was very unprofessional. The manager was typing on her computer the whole time I was being interviewed by two other ladies. she was very in personable.
Interview Questions: Tell us why we should hire you?

title: Health Informatics Interview

title: Patient Care Associate Interview

Interview Descriptions: Hr phone call for a phone screening and then came in person for an in person meeting and then with the manager. Overall the general questions and process was not difficult.

title: Manager Interview

The interviews were both straightforward and relaxed, and I was met with a sense of dignity and respect.  Very thorough and fair process, which I believe gave me significant insight into the culture of the organization. This is a a very high performing organization, and truly talented managers are critical.

title: Staff Nurse Interview

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2014

The questions were standard behavioral interview questions. It was a slightly confusing interview. Typically I can tell how it went but honestly she seemed to not care at all. I was shocked to hear back and truthfully she hasn't seemed to care much at all since I started working.
Interview Questions: Do not remember the questions?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: 6 people interviewed me. Ask questions about my background of previous position. Ask some random questions about my experience in different places and describe yourself as they read my resume. They were very nice. Just be cool, and you can survive.
Interview Questions: Use three words to describe yourself. This is challenging one. Try to use stories to support the three words instead of only three words.

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: They asked me 0 questions and asked me instead what questions I had.  I had researched the position in advance so was ready.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Pharmacy Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: The HR lady was very rude. But the people in the department was fair and to the point. You have to certified to get into this position. The interview did not take long at all. Interviewed with two people. They didn't start me off with the right pay it was less than what I was entitled to.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Account Representative Interview

title: FMLA Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: One on one then panel interview. Turn around time to hear from a recruiter took about two months. Manger is very pleasent and professional as well as the team. I could definitely tell they stand behind their mission.

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a nice experience they were really interested in what I wanted to do with my future. They were concerned about all of the experience I've had in the past and why I left my last position. I actually recieved a call back the next day after my interview.

title: Medical Staff Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted by a recruiter to schedule the interview.  The manager interviewed me and then I met with the other staff members.  Very easy going interview. Questions comprised of the basics as well as behavioral type questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was read word for word from a book. The human resource person would read a question and I was to interpret and answer to the best of my ability. The human resource person was not allowed to explain the questions or use any other words than what had been written in the book; all that they were allowed to do was repeat the question. My responses were then recorded as I spoke them. If I found a question particularly troubling I was allowed to skip it; but, it was bookmarked and revisited at the end. However, "I don't know" did prove to be a viable answer.
Interview Questions: The questions were like those of many online pre-employment tests that ask the same question in several different was to check you moral compass and determine if you would be a good fit for their organization. There were also the standard, "Tell me something about yourself" type of questions.

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was phone interview. Then a panel interview. With hr, manager, supervisor. My interview was an hour. The group was nice and I didn't feel nervous. I felt confident when I left.
Interview Questions: If you had to choose in a group which one would you be? A leader, supporter, analyzer?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Emailed resume and coverletter, took a few weeks to hear for interview invitation, 3 panels in the interview group, went for an hour, took a couple months to hear the result
Interview Questions: Describe your three achievements in your life

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by an HR representative and then interviewed by floor manager, 2 Lead Charge Nurses. I received a phone call with a job offer as I was driving away in the car. This is not always the case though, as I interviewed for another floor a year later and it took them 2 weeks to call me and offer me the job.
Interview Questions: What's the thing you love most about your current job?

title: Full Time CNA Day Shift - Progress West Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (O Fallon, MO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The women in HR were very unorganized and poor communication with each other. They took a long time to return any of my calls. I wouldn't apply for another position or would ever want to work there.
Interview Questions: Would you accept night shift?

title: Mental Health Social Worker (Unlicensed) Interview

title: Program Manager Interview

title: Performance Improvement Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: There was a several week delay between my first contact and a call to schedule the face to face interview.  Once the interview finally happened it was a panel of about 10 people asking me questions from a list.  Normally it would have been intimidating but everyone was very laid back and friendly.  I was asked back the next day for a second face to face interview with the departments Sr. Management.  These were just a formality and one last chance to make sure I was not a jerk.  The offer came within the week.
Interview Questions: Not any one question comes to mind.  Be prepared to discuss in detail  your experience with Lean and Six Sigma.

title: Medical Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Get through interview with HR then they will send you to the office for an interview with the Office manager.  If the office manager likes you then you can meet the Doctors and they choose after that
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself helping our practice?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online then a few weeks later I received a call from HR and they did a phone interview. Very nice people in HR. She set me up with the nursing manager of the orthopedics unit where I would be working. I went to the orthopedics floor and took a tour of the facility, then went back for my interview. She was very nice and knew I was a nursing student so she said I would be able to go to conferences for free while I worked here, which was a nice benefit! Then after the interview I was able to shadow one of the secretaries on duty and she told me I got the job! I started a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: What I wanted out of working at BJH.

title: Group Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process took nearly 2 years.  It was a new/specialized position in an innovative area charged with standardizing systems and processes across hospitals that had previously been autonomously organized.  I talked with people representing business, information technology, methodology and management over about 15 meetings.
This was an exciting opportunity to establish new project delivery practices in a fast-paced, highly charged, highly visible, and highly valuable work environment.
<Note that this page does not allow interview processes to take ove 365 days.  This one was non-standard and took nearly 2 years.>
Interview Questions: What area do you want to focus on?  Process improvement, quality management, project management?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2013

The hiring process after the interview was quick and painless. They do seem to want an individual who is very much a team player and that has a lot of initiative. title: Technical Specialist Interview

title: Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Pretty simple. Applied online, HR phone call, interview with hiring manager, group inteview. 
 Applied online then HR contacted me by phone two weeks later asking if I was still interestered. Scheduled an in person interview for a few days later. First interview was with hiring manager (nursing manager of the unit). This interview was super laid back, we talked casually for a few minutes then she asked me about my self and then asked for an example of why I decided to work in health care. She then showed me around the unit and met potential coworkers. Hiring manager explained that they were conducting a few more interviews and she would contact me and let me know about the next phase of the process which is a group interview. 4 days later I was contacted for the group interview. Again, group very friendly and asked scripted behavior based questions and wrote down what I said. Manager said they would be in contact if they wished to proceed. Week later HR called with offer. Then didnt hear from them for 2 weeks. Had to call twice in order to schedule background and drug screen and new employee cultural orientation.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you encountered an unexpected obstacle outwork, how did you handle it, what was the outcome?

title: Lead Charge Nurse1 Interview

I felt that the staff on the floor was very open and friendly. They told me what was good and bad about the floor. Teamwork seemed to be above average but employee satisfaction seemed average.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Different facilities have different processes. There is always a phone interview from corporate HR, then local HR, then 1 on 1 HR with a personalty test. Then there is an interview with the Manager of the department. Then some facilities will have a group interview with different members of the department all represented.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time when you could have given better care.  Why did it happen, and what will you do to avoid this in the future.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call from a recruiter.  I had a phone interview, then was invited to come in for a face to face interview.  From there, I had an interview with the Lead Charge Nurse of th unit.  She offered me a position and I accepted.  They still had to do a background check and a company physical with drug test.  Since I was on a medication that would show up on a drug test, I brought a note from my physician, the prescription bottle, and receipt from the pharmacy.  After "failing" the drug test, I was told that everything would be put on hold while my drug test would be verified by gas chromatography to make sure that was really the medicine I was taking.  This took 2 weeks.  After the results came back and they proved I was taking my prescribed medication, I had to have the pharmacy receipt faxed to the occupational health doctor.  This was the same receipt I brought with me whem I took the drug test and the occupational health nurse refused to take.  After this, I signed my papers and started orientation within the next week or so.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The arrangements for the interview were very concise and clear.  Very nice office environment.  Met with HR first and found the rep to be very personal and friendly.  General questions regarding my current situation were asked and followed by a couple of questions like "give me an example of when you had a situation that turned out poorly and tell me what you learned from it." 

The next group had an HR Rep and an employee.  They asked several questions like "tell me when you had this experience" with regard to systems, groups worked with, scope of your job, etc.  The questions were meant to get an idea of how many people you managed, how large groups were that you worked with and other metrics in your past experience. 

The last group consisted of managers.  It was the end of the day, the interview schedule had gone past the scheduled time and they appeared tired.  They asked similar behavioral questions, similar to the previous group,.  They also asked "how" you completed tasks, interacted with people, how you determined priorities.  It seemed like they were waiting for a pre-determined answer and I could tell that my responses did not hit the keywords they were searching for.  

The interview exceeded the time allowed, so I did not get to ask the questions that I had planned to ask.  Each group had a long list of questions and it was evident that they did not allow enough time to get through the list, nor did they allow enough time to probe deeper into some of the questions.  

The groups did not describe the position well nor did they describe what they needed in the position; this made it difficult to accurately target responses to show how my experiences would meet their needs.  They preferred to ask all of the questions without giving much guidance, waiting for the candidate to say the magic words.
Interview Questions: What is the largest group that you have worked with?

title: Internal Audit Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Farmington, MO) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Standard HR interview with usual questions regarding education and previous employment. Met with HR to review resume and qualifications. After HR interview another interview was scheduled by phone with the department managers of several hospital departments due to multiple openings. The second interview day was spent touring the facility and meeting/interviewing with departmental managers. The final interview was a peer interview with several nurses and a unit secretary from the preferred unit. All of the meetings consisted of basic questions reviewing work ethic, personality, handling of difficult situations, and examples of such from professional experience.
Interview Questions: Why should we not hire you?

title: SQL Server Report Writer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BJC HealthCare (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I spent the first hour with two very nice women answering personality and team cooperation questions - how would I handle an uncooperative co-worker, how would I handle a situation where I knew the boss was wrong, etc. etc.  Most of the questions were fairly standard, but I got the impression that they must have had problems in the past with computer people with poor social skills.  

The second hour I spent discussing technical questions with two of my potential teammates.  They were standard questions and dealt primarily with the skills required by the job.  Only a couple of them were of the "obscure detail" variety - the questions interviewers ask, not so much to see if you know the answer, but more to see how much you will try to BS your way out of admitting not knowing the answer.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with SQL Server Reporting Services?
